thread.title: Glenn Beck Unleashes After Tomi Lahren Betrays Him, Conservatives Everywhere
thread.title_full: Glenn Beck Unleashes After Tomi Lahren Betrays Him, Conservatives Everywhere

author: Ben Marquis
title: Glenn Beck Unleashes After Tomi Lahren Betrays Him, Conservatives Everywhere
text:
Maddow Claims People “Expected Too Much” 
According to The Hill , however, Lahren’s comments didn’t sit well with her boss, TheBlaze founder Glenn Beck , who excoriated his popular employee on Twitter by questioning her intellectual honesty on the subject. 
Beck’s tweet was in response to a tweet Lahren had initially posted in response to the criticism she had received from betrayed conservative fans following her comments, writing, “have moderate, conservative, and libertarian views. I’m human. I will never apologize, to anyone, for being an independent thinker.” I have moderate, conservative, and libertarian views. I'm human. I will never apologize, to anyone, for being an independent thinker. 
— Tomi Lahren (@TomiLahren) March 18, 2017 
Beck tweeted, “Wait, libertarian views? Help me out on Trumpcare, stimulus, and executive orders. Trump is anything but libertarian. # intellectualhonesty” Wait, libertarian views? Help me out on Trumpcare, stimulus, and executive orders. Trump is anything but libertarian. #intellectualhonesty https://t.co/jlt5sFvQMP 
— Glenn Beck (@glennbeck) March 20, 2017 
A report from The Daily Caller prior to Beck’s tweet noted that Lahren’s time at TheBlaze could be running short, as her contract expires in September and inside sources suggest she likely won’t be renewed.   
Following this latest tiff, the possibility that she could be out of the network before her contract is up has likely increased. 
It is worth noting that, for someone who claimed to hold libertarian views, Lahren is seemingly unfamiliar with one of the political ideology’s key tenets regarding limited government, that being John Stuart Mill’s “harm principle,” which essentially states that governments retain the right to exercise power over an individual’s liberty for the sake of preventing harm to others. 
Thus, with this principle in mind, it becomes clear that one can simultaneously be in favor of limited government and against a woman’s right to choose the murder of an unborn baby. 
Tomi Lahren might be wise to reconsider her stance when it comes to abortion, as abandoning the pro-life segment of her fan base likely won’t leave her with much support at all.
